tit.cmt: タイトルのため、Kamikoromoのみとしました。

sen.j: 紙衣（かみころも、かみきぬ）は和紙を材料とした着物のことである。
sen.e: Kamikoromo (kamikinu) is a Kimono made of Japanese paper.
Kamikoromo (Kamikinu) is a Kimono made of Japanese paper.
Kamikoromo (Kamikinu) is a Kimono made of Japanese paper.
It is also referred to as `Kamiko.'

sen.cmt: クォーテーション修正
sen.e: It is also referred to as 'Kamiko.'

sen.j: 平安中期に和紙が大量生産されて普及した。
sen.e: In the middle of the Heian period, Japanese paper was produced in large volume, and became widely available.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the middle of the Heian period, Japanese paper was produced in large volume, and became widely available.

sen.j: その結果、紙が本来の目的以外に利用されるようになり、もともと麻クズを原料にして製造されている和紙は衣料として利用されるようになった。
sen.e: As a result, papers came to be used for purposes other than the original purpose, and Japanese paper, which was originally made from tow, came to be used for clothes.

sen.j: 絹の衣よりも安価なため、低所得者が利用する着物と思われがちだ。
sen.e: Since it is cheaper than silk clothes, Kamikoromo tends to be considered as Kimono which was worn by people with low income.

sen.j: しかし、丈夫で持ち運びに便利なため、武士や俳人などが好んで利用した。
sen.e: In fact, because it is strong and is conveniently carried, Samurai or haiku poet preferred to use it.

sen.j: 性空や親鸞が愛用していたことでも知られる。
sen.e: It is also known that Shoku or Shinran often wore it.

sen.j: 紙衣の原料には特に粘り強い紙を必要とした。
sen.e: Sticky and strong papers were required for the raw material of Kamikoromo.

sen.j: 十文字漉きされた繊維の絡みが強い美濃十文字紙などが使用された。
sen.e: Papers including Mino Jumonji paper which was teased in a cross shape and was made of tightly-entangled fibers were used.

sen.j: そして、それを柿渋を引いては乾かす作業を複数回行った。
sen.e: It was coated with astringent persimmon juice and dried for several times.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 晴天の日に一夜晒し、足で踏んだり手で揉んだりして柔らかくして紙衣を製造した。
sen.e: On a sunny day, it was dried overnight, and was softened through the process of stepping or rubbing by hands to be made into Kamikoromo.
